physical_appearance: The drawing is made on a piece of paper that has been torn on its bottom right side and the upper left corner. The drawing depicts the military insignia of the 122 Field Regiment Royal Artillery. It also includes the names of places where the Regiment fought at during the Malayan Campaign in World War II. The paper does not look creased. The location where the drawing is created is also stated at the bottom centre.
sgcool_label_text: "A drawing that memorializes the involvement of the 122 Field Regiment Royal Artillery in the Malayan Campaign, this diagram includes all the areas in which they fought during the campaign and their motto” Quo Fas Et Gloria Ducunt” (""Where Right And Glory Lead""; in Latin fas implies ""sacred duty""). This is a particularly important historical document. Effectively
title_text: 122 Field Regiment Royal Artillery’s involvement in the Malayan Campaign Drawing memorializing 122 Field Regiment Royal Artillery’s involvement in the Malayan Campaign
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war prisoner-of-war camps commemoratives
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939 - 1945 Great Britain. Army Prisoner of war Prisoner-of-war camps Drawing Changi POW Camp (Changi, Singapore)
